solution_line_template: If {map_unit_fraction} inch on the map represents {miles_per_map_unit} miles on real land, 1 inch represents {inches_per_unit} * {miles_per_map_unit} = {miles_per_inch} miles.

Since 1 inch represents {miles_per_inch} miles, {whole_inches} inches represent {whole_inches} * {miles_per_inch} = <<{whole_inches}*{miles_per_inch}={miles_for_whole_inches}>>{miles_for_whole_inches} miles.

{map_unit_fraction} inch represents {miles_per_map_unit} miles, {smaller_map_unit_fraction} inch represents {miles_per_map_unit} / {map_unit_fraction} / {smaller_map_unit_fraction} = <<{miles_per_map_unit}/{map_unit_fraction}/{smaller_map_unit_fraction}={miles_for_smaller_unit}>>{miles_for_smaller_unit} miles because {smaller_map_unit_fraction} is half of {map_unit_fraction}.

If {smaller_map_unit_fraction} inch represents {miles_for_smaller_unit} miles, {fractional_inches_numerator}/{smaller_map_unit_fraction.denominator} of an inch represents {fractional_inches_numerator} * {miles_for_smaller_unit} = {miles_for_fractional_inches} miles.

This means {whole_inches} {fractional_inches_numerator}/{smaller_map_unit_fraction.denominator} inches on the map translate to {miles_for_whole_inches} + {miles_for_fractional_inches} = {total_miles} miles.
